snippet: A judge on Friday dismissed all charges against Samuel Kellner, a Hasidic Jew who has lived as an outcast for years after accusing a prominent cantor of sexually abusing his son.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column examines case of Samuel Kellner of Brooklyn, a Hasidic Jew who lived as an outcast for years after accusing prominent cantor Baruch Lebovits of sexually abusing his son and was then charged with extortion against the cantor; observes that although all charges against Kellner have now been dropped, the damage to his reputation and his family has left his life in tatters.
lead_paragraph: A judge on Friday dismissed all charges against Samuel Kellner, a Hasidic Jew who has lived as an outcast for years after accusing a prominent cantor of sexually abusing his son.

headline.main: After Seeing His Family Crumble, Vindicated Whistle-Blower Has Little to Smile About
headline.print_headline: After Seeing His Family Crumble, Vindicated Whistle-Blower Has Little to Smile About
